intro: Taraxacum meierottii, commonly known as the Meierott's dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and a yellow composite flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed sphere. Native to central Europe, this plant thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The plant is notable for its ability to spread via wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
